item_title: CALL TO ORDER and ROLL CALL

item_blurb: Public comments that are not related to any of the items specifically listed on the agenda will be heard at approximately 9:00 am, for no more than one hour. At the discretion of the Chair, speakers may be given up to 2 minutes. Due to the transition to a virtual meeting platform, the Coastal Commission at this time will not allow for the ceding of time from one speaker to another speaker. Note: You may address the Commission on a specific topic one time only each month. Please submit a request to speak by 5:00 pm the day before the hearing to assist with meeting management sign up. We will stop taking speaker requests by 8:30 am on each day of the meeting. Please see the Coastal Commission’s Virtual Hearing Procedures memo for submitting a request to speak.

subitem_title: Executive Director's Report
Commission Correspondence
subitem_blurb: Consideration and potential action on Commission correspondence.

subitem_title: Legislative Report
subitem_blurb: Status report and possible action on pending legislation (KH/SC-SF)

subitem_title: Application No. 1-22-0358 (Parks & Rec., Stagecoach Hill Azalea Nature Trail Accessibility Improvements, Humboldt Co.)
subitem_blurb: Application of California Department of Parks & Recreation North Coast Redwoods District to improve to accessibility standards an approx. 0.5-mile-long nature trail by widening and improving existing trail segments, decommissioning and rerouting trail segments, adding retaining walls, installing ADA-compliant parking stall, wooden bench, and signage, replacing culvert, and enhancing adjacent habitat to mitigate for rare plant impacts, at Stagecoach Hill Azalea Nature Trail, Humboldt Lagoons State Park, Humboldt County. (CM-A)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-23-0209 (Los Angeles County Department of Public Works, Will Rogers State Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Los Angeles County Department of Public Works for authorization of emergency installation of 300 tons of rip rap and metal plates along two flood control channel walls to mitigate sediment erosion and the potential exposure of bridge piles and abutments at Marvin Braude Beach Trail Bridge at Will Rogers State Beach. (ETP-LB)

item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, local government acceptance of modifications for LCP certification and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. For specific information contact the Commission's Arcata office at (707) 826-8950.

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-1-EUR-24-0004 (The Carrington Company, Eureka)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by Cynthia Le Doux-Bloom, Eric Bloom, Joyce Canepa, & Ken Canepa from decision of City of Eureka granting permit with conditions to The Carrington Company to adjust lot lines between three legal parcels approx. 54.7 acres (ac), 14 ac, & 15.8 ac resulting in three parcels of 3 ac, 61.3 ac, & 20.2 ac, at 14775 Broadway (aka 4635 Broadway), Eureka, Humboldt County. (TRG-A)

subitem_title: Application No. 1-22-0797 (Tebon, Humboldt County)
subitem_blurb: Application of Scott and Jennifer Tebon to construct 3,560-sf, two-story, 2-bedroom single-family home with associated decks, porches, 630-sq.ft. garage, driveway, parking area, onsite wastewater treatment system, convert test well to production well, and approximately 1,700 cu.yds. of grading at 1316 Kane Road, 13 miles north of Trinidad, Humboldt County. (CM-A)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

item_blurb: Report by the Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, negative determinations, matters not requiring public hearings, and status report on offshore oil & gas exploration & development.  For specific information contact the Commission’s Energy, Ocean Resources, and Federal Consistency Division office at (415) 904-5240.
subitem_title: Informational update on trans-boundary pollution crisis in the Tijuana River and Tijuana River Valley
subitem_blurb: Update on the status and impacts of the Tijuana River pollution crisis and recent efforts and coordination activities carried out in response.

subitem_title: CD-0003-24 (United States Space Force).
subitem_blurb: Consistency determination by the United States Space Force to increase Space Exploration Technologies’ (SpaceX) Falcon 9 launch and landing activities at Vandenberg Space Force Base (VSFB) from six to 36 per year as well as the addition of offshore landing locations in the Pacific Ocean Vandenberg Space Force Base, Santa Barbara County. (WH-SF)

item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, local government acceptance of modifications for LCP certification and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. For specific information contact the Commission's Ventura office at (805) 585-1800.

subitem_title: Pepperdine University Notice of Impending Development No. PEP-NOID-0002-24 (Firestone Fieldhouse Renovation).
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on Notice of Impending Development by Pepperdine University for partial renovation and improvements to portions of the existing Firestone Fieldhouse athletics building located within the interior, developed portion of Pepperdine University’s Malibu Campus, Los Angeles County. (SF-V)

item_title: Deputy Director's Report For Los Angeles County
item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, local government acceptance of modifications for LCP certification and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. For specific information contact the Commission's Long Beach office at (562) 590-5071.

subitem_title: Application Nos. A-5-VEN-21-0063 & 5-24-0254 (811 Ocean Front Walk, LLC)
subitem_blurb: Application of 811 Ocean Front Walk, LLC for the demolition of a 1,651 sq. ft. single-family home and construction of a new 35 ft. tall, 5,235 sq. ft. mixed-use development with 469 sq. ft. of ground floor retail use and 4,766 sq. ft. of first, second, and third floor single-family residential use with six on-site parking spaces on a 4,498 sq. ft. lot at 811 Ocean Front Walk in Venice, City of Los Angeles, Los Angeles County. (TS – LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-23-0210 (California Dept. Of Fish and Wildlife, Marina Del Rey)
subitem_blurb: Application of California Department of Fish and Wildlife for after-the-fact approval of installation of 6-ft. high (4-ft. above grade) approx. 1,745 linear ft., T-post and barbless wire wildlife permeable fence along existing pedestrian walking trail within Area A of the Ballona Wetlands Ecological Reserve in Marina del Rey, Los Angeles County. (MR-LB) (Note: the Commission’s enforcement division has opened an investigation into potential Coastal Act violations associated with this item and site, as explained further in the staff report.)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-23-0628 (Navid Khodayari Family Trust, Pacific Palisades)
subitem_blurb: Application of Navid Khodayari Family Trust to demolish existing approximately 4,200 sq. ft. single-family home with a detached 2-car garage and construct a new approximately 10,505 sq. ft., two-story single-family home including a 4,325 sq. ft. basement, attached 4-car garage, pool, and spa at 15851 Asilomar Blvd, Pacific Palisades, Los Angeles County. (ETP-LB)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

item_blurb: At a convenient time during the meeting, the Commission (CCC) will have a closed session to discuss items of pending litigation, including:

item_title: CALL TO ORDER and ROLL CALL

PLEASE NOTE THAT THERE WILL BE NO GENERAL PUBLIC COMMENT ON THURSDAY. If you wish to speak during the General Public Comment period, please submit a request to speak on Wednesday or Friday’s agenda. Note: There WILL still be public comment on each of the individual agenda items on Thursday. If you wish to speak on a specific item on the agenda, please use the green button above to submit a speaker request form and indicate the item number where prompted.
(There will be no General Public Comment today)

item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, local government acceptance of modifications for LCP certification and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report.  For specific information contact the Commission’s San Francisco office at (415) 904-5260.

subitem_title: Marin County LCP Amendment Number LCP-2-MAR-24-0002-1 (Short Term Rentals).
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and potential action on request by Marin County to amend the LCP Land Use Plan  to establish new short-term rental provisions, and if the Commission does not take a final action, possible action to extend the deadline for final Commission action on the amendment. (SR-SF)

subitem_title: Sonoma County LCP Amendment Number LCP-2-SON-23-0042-1 (Vacation Rental Requirements).
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and potential action on request by Sonoma County to amend the LCP Implementation Plan to establish new regulations regarding vacation rentals, and if the Commission does not take a final action, possible action to extend the deadline for final Commission action on the amendment. (LH-SF)

subitem_title: Public Works Plan No. PWP-2-MAR-24-0001-1 (Tomales Bay State Park Forest Health and Wildfire Resilience Public Works Plan).
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and potential action on California State Parks’ proposed Public Works Plan that would allow a 10-year vegetation treatment program designed to enhance ecosystems and improve wildfire resilience (in tandem and pursuant to the State Board of Forestry’s certified California Vegetation Treatment Program Programmatic Environmental Impact Report) in Tomales Bay State Park within the Marin County coastal zone and, if the Commission does not take final action, possible action to extend the deadline for final Commission action on the Public Works Plan. (EP-SF)

subitem_title: Application No. 2-23-0879 (Schmehl SFD, Seadrift)
subitem_blurb: Application by Mark Schmehl to renovate interior and exterior of 2,145 sq.ft. single-family home and add 90 sq.ft. addition, at 117 Dipsea Road, within private Seadrift community just upcoast of unincorporated Stinson Beach area of Marin County. (LV-SF)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

subitem_title: Application No. A-2-SMC-11-041-A1-EDD (Hodge, San Mateo County)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by David and Hi-Jin Hodge of the Executive Director's determination that the proposed CDP amendment (to construct an ADU in a habitat restoration deed restricted area) lessens and avoids the intended effect of the permit (pursuant to CCR § 13166), unincorporated Miramar area of San Mateo County. (IC-SF) (Note: the Commission’s enforcement division has opened an investigation into potential Coastal Act violations associated with this item and site, as referenced in the staff report.)

item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, local government acceptance of modifications for LCP certification and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report.  For specific information contact the Commission’s Santa Cruz office at (831) 427-4863.

subitem_title: City of Capitola LCP Amendment No. LCP-3-CAP-22-0061-2 Part B (Monarch Cove Inn Site Redesignation).
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and potential action on request by the City of Capitola to amend its certified LCP Land Use Plan and Implementation Plan to modify provisions related to land use/zoning and implementing regulations for the Monarch Cove Inn site, and if the Commission does not take a final action, possible action to extend the deadline for final Commission action on the amendment. (KF-SC)

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-3-PGR-24-0002 (Pacific Grove Retreat B&B, Pacific Grove)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by Anthony Ciani of City of Pacific Grove decision granting permit with conditions to Renewable Energy Development, LLC, for the conversion of an 8-unit multifamily residence to an 8-unit bed and breakfast inn, at 270 Central Avenue, in the Pacific Grove Retreat Neighborhood, Pacific Grove, Monterey County. (KB-SC)

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-3-PGR-22-0004 (American Tin Cannery Hotel and Commercial Project, Pacific Grove)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by Commissioners Linda Escalante and Caryl Hart, Pacific Grove Coast Watch, Kim Akeman, Thom Akeman, Anthony Ciani, Jane Haines, and Michelle Raine of City of Pacific Grove decision granting CDP with conditions to Foursome Development Company for partial demolition and complete redevelopment and expansion of the existing American Tin Cannery commercial building to create a new 225-room hotel resort with related development (including two pools, a spa and fitness center, restaurants, banquet/meeting rooms, 290 underground and surface parking spaces, and approximately 11,000 sq.ft. of retail uses), totaling roughly 350,000 sq.ft. of total floor area; vacation of portions of the Sloat Avenue public street and Ocean View Boulevard sidewalk for private hotel use; and approximately 47,000 cu. yds. of grading, on a 5.6-acre site at 109/125 Ocean View Boulevard and 124 Central Avenue, Pacific Grove, Monterey County. (MF/KV-SC)

At the discretion of the Chair, speakers may be given up to 2 minutes. Due to the transition to a virtual meeting platform, the Coastal Commission at this time will not allow for the ceding of time from one speaker to another speaker. Note: You may address the Commission on a specific topic one time only each month. Please submit a request to speak by 5:00 pm the day before the hearing to assist with meeting management sign up. We will stop taking speaker requests by 8:30 am on each day of the meeting. Please see the Coastal Commission’s Virtual Hearing Procedures memo for submitting a request to speak.

subitem_title: Application No. 5-23-0577 (Lido Isle Community Association, Newport Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Lido Isle Community Association to remove and replace existing floating dock system like-for-like with new floating dock system consisting of a wooden frame instead of concrete and including four (4) less piles, at 398 Via Lido Nord, Newport Beach, Orange County. (FSY-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-23-0868 (Dahlstrom, Huntington Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Greg Dahlstrom to remove and replace existing 383 sq. ft. floating dock with 54 sq. ft. gangway like-for-like. Two existing 16-in. guide piles to be reused in their same location at 16315 Niantic Circle, Huntington Beach, Orange County. (EG-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-23-0411 (Lopez, Surfside--Seal Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Jeff Lopez to demolish existing three-story 2,147 sq. ft. single-family home with attached garage and construct new 2,182 sq. ft. three-story, approximately 35 ft. high, single-family home with attached 407 sq. ft. two-car garage at 50A Surfside Avenue, Surfside – Seal Beach, Orange County. (EG-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-23-0672 (Olson, Newport Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Robert Olson to remove two existing U-shaped floating docks with 2,077 sq. ft. of water coverage and 15 piles with 16.8 sq. ft. of fill, and install new 1,538 sq. ft. L-shaped floating dock with 10 piles and 12.5 sq. ft. of fill at 921 Via Lido Soud, Newport Beach, Orange County. (JP-LB)

item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, local government acceptance of modifications for LCP certification and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. For specific information contact the Commission's Long Beach office at (562) 590-5071.

subitem_title: City of Newport Beach LCP Amendment No. LCP-5-NPB-22-0056-1-Part A(Density Bonus).
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action regarding City of Newport Beach’s request to amend the Implementation Plan (IP) of the City’s Certified Local Coastal Program (LCP) to incorporate standards and establish an approval process for considering density bonuses with housing development projects.  (FSY-LB)
subitem_status: Moved to consent Approved as recommended

subitem_title: City of Newport Beach LCP Amendment No. LCP-5-NPB-23-0019-1-Parts A and B (ADUs and Bay Island).
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action regarding City of Newport Beach’s request to amend the Implementation Plan and Land Use Plan of the City’s certified Local Coastal Program to: A) revise development standards for accessory dwelling units to ensure consistency with state law and B) modify development standards for Bay Island in the City of Newport Beach, Orange County. (CS-LB)

subitem_title: City of Huntington Beach LCP Amendment No. LCP-5-HNB-24-0003-1. Time Extension.
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action to extend the 90-day time limit for Commission action for up to one year on the City of Huntington Beach request to amend both the Land Use Plan (LUP) and the Implementation Plan (IP) of the certified Local Coastal Program (LCP), including land use and zoning designation changes and adding the Magnolia Tank Farm Specific Plan to the IP, in City of Huntington Beach, Orange County. (MV-LB)
subitem_status: Moved to consent Approved as recommended

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-5-DPT-24-0005 (Watson, Dana Point)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by Chair Caryl Hart and Commissioner Paloma Aguirre from City of Dana Point decision granting permit with conditions to Rick and Wendy Watson for the demolition of 825 sq. ft. single-story single-family home on 2,137 sq. ft. beachfront lot and construction of 2,627 sq. ft., two-story single-family home above 1,025 sq. ft. lower-level garage (three levels and 3,552 sq. ft. total) with caisson foundation at 35665 Beach Road, Dana Point, Orange County. (JP-LB)
subitem_status: SUBSTANTIAL ISSUE FOUND, de Novo Hearing CONTINUED

subitem_title: Application No. A-5-LGB-22-0060 (City of Laguna Beach, Laguna Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of City of Laguna Beach to demolish and replace existing sewer lift station, reconstruct stairway, Anita Street end improvements, landscaping, and install permanent lifeguard tower at the Westerly Terminus of Anita Street, Public-Right-of-Way, Laguna Beach, Orange County. (JP-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-22-0860 (City of Seal Beach Public Works Dept, Seal Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of the City of Seal Beach to rehabilitate existing 18-inch diameter cast iron potable water line in-place by using cured in-place pipe (CIPP) lining methods involving excavation of nine (9) pits to provide access to the existing 18-in. water main with 180 cu. yds. of cut and 180 cu. yds. of fill at 1st Street within the Los Cerritos Wetlands, Seal Beach, Orange County. (FSY-LB)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

subitem_title: Application No. 5-23-0291 (Caltrans State Route 1 Bicycle and Safety Improvements Project, Huntington Beach and Seal Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of California Department of Transportation to construct continuous 10-mile-long bicycle lane improvement project in both directions, and associated safety features. Bike lane and safety improvements include: widen existing Class II bike lane and refresh existing bike and vehicle lane delineations; high visibility striping of new Class II bike lanes, Class III shared lanes, and crosswalks; widen right-turn pockets; remove existing raised medians and construct 6,800 ft. of median concrete barrier, in order to create more shoulder width for the bike lane; reconstruction of curb ramps and sidewalks; install bike detection sensors; install signage; replace and extend guardrail to protect a traffic signal; install bike-friendly grates; remove  21 ornamental median trees; and relocate traffic signal along State Route 1 between the Santa Ana River Bridge and Anderson Street in Huntington Beach and Seal Beach.(ME-LB)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

subitem_title: Application No. 5-23-0345 (NMUSD, Newport Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Newport-Mesa Unified School District (NMUSD) to replace existing playground including new playground equipment and associated grading and site work including new recycled synthetic rubber playground surfacing and masonry site walls, at 1327 West Ocean Front, Newport Beach, Orange County. (FSY-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-23-0701 (SCRRA & OCTA, San Clemente)
subitem_blurb: Application of Southern California Regional Rail Authority (SCRRA) and Orange County Transportation Authority (OCTA) for continued authorization of development undertaken under emergency coastal development permit to construct approximately 250 ft. long, 12 ft. high, temporary soldier pile and timber lagging barrier wall within railroad right-of-way seaward of Casa Romantica Cultural Center and Garden at 415 Avenida Granada at Orange Subdivision Mile Post 204.6, San Clemente, Orange County (EG-LB).
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, local government acceptance of modifications for LCP certification and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. For specific information contact the Commission's San Diego office at (619) 767-2370.

subitem_title: City of Del Mar LCP Amendment No. LCP-6-DMR-23-0001-2 (Del Mar ADU Update). Time Extension.
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action to extend the 60-day time limit for Commission action for up to one year on request by City of Del Mar to amend its certified Implementation Program to update ADU regulations to conform with State law. (SL-SD)
subitem_status: Moved to consent Approved as recommended

subitem_title: City of San Diego LCP Amendment No. LCP-6-SAN-23-0027-2 (Housing Action Package).
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on request by City of San Diego to amend its certified Local Coastal Program to amend various chapters of the Land Development Code addressing housing and accessory dwelling units to implement Senate Bill 9. (AL-SD)
subitem_status: Moved to consent Approved as recommended

subitem_title: City of San Diego LCP Amendment No. LCP-6-SAN-23-0052-3 (Housing Action Package ADU Amendment).
subitem_blurb: Concurrence with the Executive Director’s determination that the request by City of San Diego to amend its certified Local Coastal Program to change the amount of time an accessory dwelling unit must be deed-restricted as very low-income or low-income housing in order to qualify for an additional accessory dwelling unit is de minimis. (AL-SD)
subitem_status: Moved to consent Approved as recommended

subitem_title: Application No. A-6-ENC-22-0059 (Newman, Encinitas)
subitem_blurb: Application of Wesley Newman to construct 3,285 sq. ft. 2-story single-family home with 1,083 sq. ft. basement garage on 7,437 sq. ft. vacant lot, at 216 Neptune Ave, Encinitas. (KC-SD)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

subitem_title: Permit No. 6-16-0340-EDD (Moss, Carlsbad)
subitem_blurb: Appeal of the Executive Director’s determination that the amendment request for after-the-fact construction of bluff retaining walls, grading, and landscaping seaward of the identified bluff edge lessens and avoids the intended effect of the permit (pursuant to CCR § 13166); install new landscaping and hardscape; and improve private staircases on a 13,576 sq. ft. bluff top lot, at 5015 Tierra del Oro, Carlsbad, San Diego County. (CJ-SD) (Note: the Commission’s enforcement division has opened an investigation into potential Coastal Act violations associated with this item and site, as explained further in the staff report.)
